New Records: Omari Glasgow is just one goal shy of tying the country’s all-time record, set by Nigel Codrington
Key Match Events: The Golden Jaguars will look to bounce back after a 3-1 home defeat to Suriname last Thursday
Martinique also began their campaign with a 3-1 loss, falling to Guatemala
Pre-Game Insights: Coach Jamaal Shabazz’s side will be looking to bounce back after a 3-1 home defeat to Suriname last Thursday
Shabazz remains optimistic and acknowledges the challenge of facing Martinique
Team captain Elliot Bonds reflected on their performance and emphasized the need to move forward quickly
It will be interesting to see Shabazz’s approach against Martinique, a team they last faced in 2017, ending in a scoreless draw at Mackenzie Sports Club Ground in Linden
Post-Match Reflections: After the defeat to Suriname, team captain Elliot Bonds reflected on their performance and emphasized the need to move forward quickly
Miscellaneous Highlights: Martinique, playing at home, have won four and lost one of their last five matches, scoring and conceding four goals in that period
In the Nations League, Martinique have played 12 matches, winning two, drawing five, and losing five
The Golden Jaguars have struggled on the road, with one win and four losses in their last five away games, while Martinique have two wins, two draws, and one loss in their last five outings
